page.title: Adpositional Phrases - Nominal Complements
page.introduction:
The main use of prepositions or postpositions is for expressing location. Therefore, we will cover locative adpositions and PPs first. Then, for those languages which do not mark case on nouns or nominal phrases, the adpositions used to express each minor case relation will be exemplified.
Locative prepositions in English include: in, under, over, beside, above, near and through. These can be used in PPs such as in the box, beside the river, and near the wall .
Some languages use body part words to express these same meanings.
